pull.title: [0.12.2] Backports
pull.body: This includes the commits which were tagged with "needs backport".

events.message:
Do not download transactions during inital sync

Github-Pull: #7164
Rebased-From: 39a525c21fd1b34df63ab30868423b97b708ee49

Fix and cleanup listreceivedbyX documentation

Github-Pull: #7527
Rebased-From: c372572595b6b19a4dd88258401d8a0046ce4469

fix spelling of advertise in src and doc

Github-Pull: #7526
Rebased-From: 37767fd46f673a06864df6e14d3030622b1cb2c9

Remove spurious dollar sign. Fixes #7189.

Github-Pull: #7189
Rebased-From: 3d19193f14b9400f7c908a61375c330113571a38

Fix memleak in TorController [rework]

It looks like, TorController::disconnected_cb(TorControlConnection&
conn) gets called multiple times which results in multiple event_new().

Avoid this by creating the event only once in the constructore, and
deleting it only once in the destructor (thanks to Cory Fields for the
idea).

Replaces the fix by Jonas Schnelli in #7610, see discussion there.

Github-Pull: #7637
Rebased-From: e2195037116f47b11b66452351dba4fe606423a2

Don't resend wallet txs that aren't in our own mempool

Github-Pull: #7521
Rebased-From: 5a2b1c0c8b49c5ae79946e71b9f989b33c9fcf5c

Clarify description of blockindex

see issues:

https://github.com/bitcoin-dot-org/bitcoin.org/issues/1237

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/7532

Github-Pull: #7541
Rebased-From: 7eef1d0dad0c48e9faefdc4fe5cfb6182edc79ab

Remove vfReachable and modify IsReachable to only use vfLimited.

We do not know that a class of Network is reachable, only that it is not.

Github-Pull: #7553
Rebased-From: 110b62f06992d0fb989153afff2dc3aea62a674f

Avoid "Unknown command" messages when receiving getaddr on outbound connections.

Github-Pull: #7642
Rebased-From: d84ea1a59ce3704457a162f1fd8a7353047156de

Add curl to Gitian setup instrustions

curl is required to fetch dependencies

Github-Pull: #7658
Rebased-From: ce41cf082c861cc8d333b811b3101d52d06f50ec

Use txid as key in mapAlreadyAskedFor

Previously we used the CInv that would be sent to the peer announcing the
transaction as the key, but using the txid instead allows us to decouple the
p2p layer from the application logic (which relies on this map to avoid
duplicate tx requests).

Github-Pull: #7862
Rebased-From: 7e91f632c70ff1848a152f24ee67a06796803943

Removed call to `TryCreateDirectory` from `GetDefaultDataDir` in `src/util.cpp`.

See https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/7845#issuecomment-207684728.
Also refactored `GetDefaultDataDir` function to return path for Mac in one expression.

Github-Pull: #7850
Rebased-From: 41dbc4849e0bf14eef98962b0f0bddcde0bb3014

Fix headers announcements edge case

Previously we would assert that if every block in vBlockHashesToAnnounce is in
chainActive, then the blocks to be announced must connect.  However, there are
edge cases where this assumption could be violated (eg using invalidateblock /
reconsiderblock), so just check for this case and revert to inv-announcement
instead.

Github-Pull: #7919
Rebased-From: 3a99fb2cb14955f5e029d315041a093e957e6c3e

CBase58Data::SetString: cleanse the full vector

SetString seems to be passing the length of the wrong variable to
memory_cleanse, resulting in the last byte of the temporary buffer not being
securely erased.

Github-Pull: #7922
Rebased-From: 57704499be948c640c789c7fc11ed1abf8a681bd

issue.title: Do not download transactions during initial blockchain sync
issue.body: What I've noticed now that transaction rates are getting much higher is that every time a block is downloaded during the initial sync, sometimes 5, 10 or more new transactions are being downloaded as well and is slowing down the initial sync process.  There is no reason to do a "getdata" and download these transactions since they are not getting accepted into the mempool anyway.

issue.title: Avoid "Unknown command" messages when receiving getaddr on outbound c
issue.body:
onnections.

Replaces #6344 and addresses concerns raised (i.e. now logs this exceptional event).

issue.title: Don't resend wallet txs that aren't in our own mempool
fix spelling of advertise (shows up in the debug log)
issue.body: Minor spelling fix: the message `AdvertizeLocal: advertizing address 168.103.195.250:8333` in the debug log was misspelt.

issue.title: [Trivial, RPC] Fix and cleanup listreceivedbyX documentation
Remove vfReachable and modify IsReachable to only use vfLimited.
issue.body: We do not know that a class of Network is reachable, only that it is not.

issue.title: Fix memleak in TorController [rework]
issue.body:
It looks like, TorController::disconnected_cb(TorControlConnection& conn) gets called multiple times which results in multiple event_new().

Avoid this by creating the event only once in the constructore, and deleting it only once in the destructor (thanks to Cory Fields for the idea).

Replaces the fix by Jonas Schnelli in #7610, see discussion there.

issue.title: Add curl to Gitian setup instructions
issue.body:
curl is required to fetch dependencies

requires backport to all branches

[ci skip]

issue.title: Use txid as key in mapAlreadyAskedFor
issue.body:
Previously we used the `CInv` that would be sent to the peer announcing the transaction as the key, but using the txid instead allows us to decouple the p2p layer from the application logic.

This is a minor preparatory commit for segwit, in which the inv-type will no longer be the same for all transaction requests.

issue.title: Fix headers announcements edge case
issue.body:
Previously we would assert that if every block in `vBlockHashesToAnnounce` is in
`chainActive`, then the blocks to be announced must connect.  However, there are
edge cases where this assumption could be violated (eg using invalidateblock /
reconsiderblock), so just check for this case and revert to inv-announcement
instead.

FYI I encountered this bug once while running `mempool_packages.py`, and was able to reproduce reliably by repeatedly invoking `invalidateblock`/`reconsiderblock` on the tip.  

Perhaps we should backport this to 0.12 as well?

issue.title: CBase58Data::SetString: cleanse the full vector
issue.body:
SetString seems to be passing the length of the wrong variable to
memory_cleanse, resulting in the last byte of the temporary buffer not being
securely erased.

issue.title: build: Remove spurious dollar sign. Fixes #7189.
